meanings.sent1: The magician merchanted the audience with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent2: She merchanted the forest creatures with her beautiful singing.
meanings.sent3: The children merchanted their teacher into giving them extra recess time.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious potion merchanted the prince into a deep sleep.
meanings.sent5: The old book merchanted anyone who dared to open its pages.

meanings.definition: Enchanted or bewitched by magic or sorcery
meanings.sent1: The mermaid lived in a merchanted underwater palace.
meanings.sent2: The travelers stumbled upon a merchanted castle hidden in the woods.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have a merchanted ability to always find its way home.
meanings.sent4: The night sky was filled with merchanted stars that sparkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a merchanted place where flowers bloomed in all colors.
